children: Perioperative ischemic cardiac disease evaluation for noncardiac surgery.

footnotes: ACC = American College of Cardiology; AHA = American Heart Association; CAD = coronary artery disease; MACE = major adverse cardiac event; MET = metabolic equivalent.
Emergency surgery required within 6 hours to avoid loss of life or limb.
Acute coronary syndromes: myocardial infarction <30 days ago, unstable or severe angina.

Risk factors for CAD: not specifically defined in ACC/AHA guidelines; examples include known CAD, cerebrovascular disease (i.e., stroke or transient ischemic attack), chronic kidney disease, diabetes mellitus, and heart failure.
Best determined using an objective tool, such as the Duke Activity Status Index score, because subjective estimation is unreliable.

Recommendations from Fleisher LA, Fleischmann KE, Auerbach AD, et al; American College of Cardiology. 2014 ACC/AHA guideline on perioperative cardiovascular evaluation and management of patients undergoing noncardiac surgery: a report of the American College of Cardiology/American Heart Association Task Force on practice guidelines. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2014;64:e77-137.
